title: 103_s310
content:
The "Chacoan Outliers Protection Act of 1993" includes a conforming amendment to Public Law 96-550 and additions to Chaco archaeological protection sites. SEC. 3. ADDITIONS TO CHACO ARCHEOLOGICAL PROTECTION SITES. Thirty-nine outlying sites totaling approximately 14,372 acres are designated as 'Chaco Culture Archeological Protection Sites'. The following sites are designated as 'Chaco Culture Archeological Protection Sites' with varying acreages:
- Allentown: 380 acres
- Andrews Ranch: 950 acres
- Bee Burrow: 480 acres
- Bisa'ani: 131 acres
- Casa del Rio: 40 acres
- Casamero: 160 acres
- Chimney Rock: 3,160 acres
- Coolidge: 450 acres
- Dalton Pass: 135 acres
- Dittert: 480 acres
- Great Bend: 26 acres
- Greenlee Ruin: 60 acres The Chaco Culture Archeological Protection Sites include various sites such as Greenlee Ruin (60 acres), Grey Hill Spring (23 acres), Guadalupe (115 acres), Halfway House (40 acres), Haystack (565 acres), Hogback (453 acres), Indian Creek (100 acres), Jacques (66 acres), Kin Nizhoni (726 acres), Lake Valley (30 acres), Manuelito-Atsee Nitsaa (60 acres), Manuelito-Kin Hochoi (116 acres), and Muddy Water (1,090 acres). Muddy Water - 1,090
Navajo Springs - 260
Newcomb - 50
Peach Springs - 1,046
Pierre's Site - 440
Raton Well - 23
Salmon Ruin - 5
San Mateo - 61
Sanostee - 1,565
Section 8 - 10
Skunk Springs/Crumbled House - 533
Standing Rock - 348
Toh-la-kai - 10 The map referenced in the previous paragraph will be available for public inspection in various offices including the National Park Service, Bureau of Land Management, and Bureau of Indian Affairs. The Senate passed a law in 1993 authorizing assistance to the Navajo Nation for the protection and management of Chaco Culture Archeological Protection Sites through grants, contracts, or cooperative agreements under the Indian Self-Determination and Education Act.
